recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Chicken Liver Fry is a a delicious Indian recipe served as a side dish.

Earlier I thought chicken liver is a high cholesterol food and is hardly healthy, but i was shocked to learn that it is enriched with many nutrients and is beneficial if ate in moderation. It has an essential nutrient vitamin B12 which supports the production of red blood cell and prevent pernicious anemia.It keeps your thyroid healthy. It is an excellent source of protein that keeps your hair, nails, skin healthy. It promotes good eyesight as it contains vitamin A in the form of retinol, alpha and beta-carotene. As I mentioned earlier, it has to be eaten in moderation due to its high cholesterol content.

preface: My dad is an excellent cook when it comes to non-vegetarian food. I learnt this recipe from him.

procedureSteps.stepDescription: Marinate chicken liver with all dry powder, salt and 1 tsp of lemon juice. Keep in the refrigerator for minimum 4 hours or overnight.
In a kadhai\wok, put oil and let it get heated on medium heat. Add green chillies, fry for 30 secs. Add onions and fry till color changes to brown. Add ginger-garlic paste. Fry for a minute

Add marinated liver and mix it well with onions. Cover and cook on a low flame for 20 mins. Add curry leaves, mix well and cover and cook it again. In between keep frying to avoid burning. During this process, oil will get separated.
Check for salt. Once done, garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

tips.tipDesc: If you don't have ginger garlic paste, use fresh finely chopped ginger and garlic.
